title: Update marathon link and fix prizes loading issue

requirements.summary: Replace deployment QR code and link with Jhajha Marathon branding
acceptanceCriteria: DeploymentInfo component displays 'Jhajha Marathon' link instead of generic deployment URL
QR code generates correctly for the Jhajha Marathon URL
Link is copyable and opens the correct destination

file_operations.description: Update the deployment URL to point to the official Jhajha Marathon website or registration page. Replace the QR code image reference from 'deployment-qr.dim_400x400.png' to 'jhajha-marathon-qr.dim_400x400.png'. Ensure the URL is copyable and the link opens to the correct Jhajha Marathon destination. Update component text to reflect 'Jhajha Marathon' branding.

Wire the generated Jhajha Marathon QR code image (frontend/public/assets/generated/jhajha-marathon-qr.dim_400x400.png) as a static asset that the DeploymentInfo component references. This image should encode the official Jhajha Marathon URL.

requirements.summary: Debug and fix prizes display functionality to load all prize categories correctly
acceptanceCriteria: All prize data fetches successfully from backend
Prize cards display with correct amounts (₹5000/₹3000/₹1000)
Loading states and error handling work properly

file_operations.description: Debug and fix the prizes loading issue. Verify that the useGetPrizesByCategory query hook is correctly fetching data from the backend. Ensure the component properly handles loading states, error states, and successfully displays all prize categories with correct amounts (₹5000 for 1st place, ₹3000 for 2nd place, ₹1000 for 3rd place). Check that the 'overall' category filter is working correctly and all prize cards render with placement-specific icons and colors. Add console logging or error boundaries if needed to diagnose loading failures.

Review and fix the useGetPrizesByCategory query implementation. Ensure the backend actor method getPrizesByCategory() is being called correctly and that the query is properly configured with error handling. Verify that the query key is unique and that React Query caching is working as expected. Check that the actor dependency is properly tracked and queries invalidate when the actor changes.

Add debugging and error handling to the PrizesPage component. Ensure the PrizesDisplay component is properly receiving the query results and that any loading or error states are visible to the user. Add fallback UI or error messages if prize data fails to load.
